title: (Senior) Technical Product Manager
content:
Who We Are
For over 25 years, Native Instruments has been at the forefront of sonic innovation. Guided by our mission to inspire and enable creators to express themselves, we develop integrated audio hardware and software solutions for musicians, producers, engineers, and DJs of all genres and levels of experience.
 
Our Data Infrastructure Team provides the pipelines and tools that enable our analysts deriving insights from data while operating on a modern & cloud-based data infrastructure that is constantly evolving and improving. Our daily business ranges from data warehousing and table management to backend development and infrastructure maintenance. We strongly believe in collaboration; you will join an international self organised team that delivers the best possible experience to our stakeholders.
 
What You'll Do

Manage and own the discovery and delivery of new features and enhancements of our data infrastructure.
Organise and prioritise the backlog and facilitate all ceremonies of the agile development process.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their needs and translate them into user stories.
Build and maintain a technical roadmap for the data infrastructure with input from the engineers and guidance from the management team.
Own the governance of the data infrastructure and ensure that it is secure, reliable and compliant with data protection regulations.

 
What You'll Need

You have significant experience as a Product Owner or similar role in a data engineering team.
You have a proven track record of strong facilitation and communication skills, with the ability to build relationships with stakeholders at all levels. 
You enjoy working in an agile environment and have a good understanding of agile principles and practices.
You have a technical understanding of cloud infrastructure and data engineering, preferably experience with Google Cloud Platform, Airflow, BigQuery and dbt.
You are familiar with data governance and international data protection regulations.

 
About Us
Native Instruments embraces diversity and a respect for all people. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we believe the foundation of our dynamic and pioneering spirit starts with a fair and inclusive culture. At Native Instruments we value teamwork and passion, deliver inspiring experiences, continuously innovate and empower our communities, while also serving our planet.
 
All applicants will receive equal consideration for employment at Native Instruments and we encourage everyone to apply – regardless of gender identity, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.
 
Help us reach our goal in making the future of music diverse, inclusive and exciting! We encourage you to submit your application without the requirement for a photograph, identifying factors or personal status information.

demographic_questions.header: Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, Belonging, and Accessibility
demographic_questions.description:
At NI, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace that values all individuals' unique perspectives and contributions. To further this commitment, we have implemented a policy to ensure that candidates from underrepresented groups, including those related to gender, disability, ethnicity, and sexuality, have equitable opportunities in our hiring process.

If you identify with one or more of these underrepresented groups, please inform us by selecting the appropriate category during the application process, and if you meet the requirements outlined in the job description, you will automatically be considered for the interview.  Your choice to share this information is entirely voluntary and confidential. Your data will not be shared with the hiring manager without your consent.

We remain dedicated to fair and robust interview processes based on standardized criteria to evaluate all applicants objectively. However, we recognize that some individuals may face additional challenges in reaching the initial interview stage, so we have introduced this approach. Our aim is to broaden the diversity of our talent pool, promoting equal opportunities for all.

At NI, diversity and inclusion are at the heart of our values. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply and help us build a workplace that embraces diversity, fosters inclusion, and values the strength of our differences

answer_options.label: Aboriginal, Indigenous or Native - For example, Navajo Nation, Blackfeet Tribe, Mayan, Aztec, Native Village of Barrow Inupiat Traditional Government, Nome Eskimo Community, Alaska Native, Pacific Islands
Asian - For example, Chinese, Filipino, Asian Indian, Vietnamese, Korean, Japanese
White - For example, German, Irish, English, Italian, Polish, Spanish
Middle Eastern - For example, Lebanese, Iranian, Syrian
Black - For example - Black British, African American, Jamaican, Haitian, Nigerian, Ethiopian, Somalian
Hispanic, Latino, South American  - For example, Mexican or Mexican American, Puerto Rican, Cuban, Salvadoran, Dominican, Columbian
Multiple ethnic groups - for example, white and Black heritage, or any other multiple ethnic background
North African – for example Egyptian, Moroccan

questions.label: Will you now or in the future require sponsorship for employment?
How did you hear about this job?

questions.description: Our Data Privacy Policy is important. When you click "I Accept," you agree to let Native Instruments collect and use your personal information for hiring and planning. We won't share it with unauthorized third parties, but we might use it within our global company or with our trusted partners. You can find more details about this policy by clicking on the provided link.
